Title:Microsoft Windows Server 2022 STIG SCAP Benchmark - NIWC Enhanced with Manual Questions
Description:This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DOD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.
Notice:Portions of this document were developed at Naval Information Warfare Center Atlantic by employees of the Federal Government in the course of their official duties. Pursuant to title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code this software is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain. The Government assumes no responsibility whatsoever for its use by other parties, and the software is provided "AS IS" without warranty or guarantee of any kind, express or implied, including, but not limited to, the warranties of merchantability and of fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall the Government be liable for any claim, damages or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort or other dealings in the software. The Government has no obligation hereunder to provide maintenance, support, updates, enhancements, or modifications. We would appreciate acknowledgement if the software is used. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Front-Matter:This content stream was enhanced with OCIL manual questions derived from the STIG Manual by the NIWC SCC team.

Release Info:Enhanced Content 1.2.4 Date: 2023-08-04, based on Release: 1.2 Benchmark Date: 11 May 2023

Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    Automated Checks

    • V-254250 - Windows Server 2022 local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes. - Pass
    • V-254293 - Windows Server 2022 reversible password encryption must be disabled. - Pass
    • V-254352 - Windows Server 2022 Autoplay must be turned off for nonvolume devices. - Pass
    • V-254353 - Windows Server 2022 default AutoRun behavior must be configured to prevent AutoRun commands. - Pass
    • V-254354 - Windows Server 2022 AutoPlay must be disabled for all drives. - Pass
    • V-254374 - Windows Server 2022 must disable the Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges option. - Pass
    • V-254378 - Windows Server 2022 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Basic authentication. - Pass
    • V-254381 - Windows Server 2022 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not use Basic authentication. - Pass
    • V-254446 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent local accounts with blank passwords from being used from the network. - Pass
    • V-254465 - Windows Server 2022 must not allow anonymous SID/Name translation. - Pass
    • V-254466 - Windows Server 2022 must not allow anonymous enumeration of Security Account Manager (SAM) accounts. - Pass
    • V-254467 - Windows Server 2022 must not allow anonymous enumeration of shares. - Pass
    • V-254469 - Windows Server 2022 must restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares. - Pass
    • V-254474 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords. - Pass
    • V-254475 - Windows Server 2022 LAN Manager authentication level must be configured to send NTLMv2 response only and to refuse LM and NTLM. - Pass
    • V-254492 - Windows Server 2022 Act as part of the operating system user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-254496 - Windows Server 2022 create a token object user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-254500 - Windows Server 2022 debug programs user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass

    Manual Checks

    • V-254240 - Windows Server 2022 administrative accounts must not be used with applications that access the internet, such as web browsers, or with potential internet sources, such as email. - Not Checked
    • V-254385 - Windows Server 2022 must only allow administrators responsible for the domain controller to have Administrator rights on the system. - Not Checked
    • V-254392 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory SYSVOL directory must have the proper access control permissions. - Not Checked
    • V-254393 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory Group Policy objects must have proper access control permissions. - Not Checked
    • V-254394 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory Domain Controllers Organizational Unit (OU) object must have the proper access control permissions. - Not Checked
    • V-254395 - Windows Server 2022 organization created Active Directory Organizational Unit (OU) objects must have proper access control permissions. - Not Checked
    • V-254399 - Windows Server 2022 directory data (outside the root DSE) of a nonpublic directory must be configured to prevent anonymous access. - Not Checked
    • V-254413 - Windows Server 2022 domain Controller PKI certificates must be issued by the DoD PKI or an approved External Certificate Authority (ECA). - Not Checked
    • V-254414 - Windows Server 2022 PKI certificates associated with user accounts must be issued by a DoD PKI or an approved External Certificate Authority (ECA). - Not Checked
    • V-254428 - Windows Server 2022 must only allow administrators responsible for the member server or standalone or nondomain-joined system to have Administrator rights on the system. - Not Checked
    • V-254441 - Windows Server 2022 must be running Credential Guard on domain-joined member servers. - Not Checked

Results: Medium Severity (CAT II)

    Automated Checks

    • V-254247 - Windows Server 2022 must be maintained at a supported servicing level. - Pass
    • V-254269 - Windows Server 2022 must not have the Fax Server role installed. - Pass
    • V-254270 - Windows Server 2022 must not have the Microsoft FTP service installed unless required by the organization. - Pass
    • V-254271 - Windows Server 2022 must not have the Peer Name Resolution Protocol installed. - Pass
    • V-254272 - Windows Server 2022 must not have Simple TCP/IP Services installed. - Pass
    • V-254273 - Windows Server 2022 must not have the Telnet Client installed. - Pass
    • V-254274 - Windows Server 2022 must not have the TFTP Client installed. - Pass
    • V-254275 - Windows Server 2022 must not the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol installed. - Pass
    • V-254276 - Windows Server 2022 must have the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol disabled on the SMB server. - Pass
    • V-254277 - Windows Server 2022 must have the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol disabled on the SMB client. - Pass
    • V-254278 - Windows Server 2022 must not have Windows PowerShell 2.0 installed. - Pass
    • V-254279 - Windows Server 2022 FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons. - Error
    • V-254283 - Windows Server 2022 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS. - Fail
    • V-254284 - Windows Server 2022 must have Secure Boot enabled. - Fail
    • V-254285 - Windows Server 2022 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater. - Pass
    • V-254286 - Windows Server 2022 must have the number of allowed bad logon attempts configured to three or less. - Pass
    • V-254287 - Windows Server 2022 must have the period of time before the bad logon counter is reset configured to 15 minutes or greater. - Pass
    • V-254288 - Windows Server 2022 password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered. - Pass
    • V-254289 - Windows Server 2022 maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less. - Pass
    • V-254290 - Windows Server 2022 minimum password age must be configured to at least one day. - Pass
    • V-254291 - Windows Server 2022 minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters. - Pass
    • V-254292 - Windows Server 2022 must have the built-in Windows password complexity policy enabled. - Pass

    • V-254297 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by nonprivileged accounts. - Pass
    • V-254298 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the System event log must prevent access by nonprivileged accounts. - Pass

    • V-254332 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - System Integrity failures. - Pass
    • V-254333 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent the display of slide shows on the lock screen. - Pass
    • V-254334 - Windows Server 2022 must have WDigest Authentication disabled. - Pass
    • V-254339 - Windows Server 2022 insecure logons to an SMB server must be disabled. - Pass

    • V-254342 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to enable Remote host allows delegation of nonexportable credentials. - Pass
    • V-254344 - Windows Server 2022 Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers identified as bad. - Pass
    • V-254345 - Windows Server 2022 group policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed. - Pass
    • V-254346 - Windows Server 2022 downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be turned off. - Pass
    • V-254347 - Windows Server 2022 printing over HTTP must be turned off. - Pass

    • V-254350 - Windows Server 2022 users must be prompted to authenticate when the system wakes from sleep (plugged in). - Pass
    • V-254355 - Windows Server 2022 administrator accounts must not be enumerated during elevation. - Pass
    • V-254356 - Windows Server 2022 Diagnostic Data must be configured to send "required diagnostic data" or "optional diagnostic data". - Fail
    • V-254358 - Windows Server 2022 Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater. - Pass
    • V-254359 - Windows Server 2022 Security event log size must be configured to 196608 KB or greater. - Pass
    • V-254360 - Windows Server 2022 System event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater. - Pass

    • V-254362 - Windows Server 2022 Explorer Data Execution Prevention must be enabled. - Pass
    • V-254364 - Windows Server 2022 File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode. - Pass
    • V-254365 - Windows Server 2022 must not save passwords in the Remote Desktop Client. - Pass
    • V-254366 - Windows Server 2022 Remote Desktop Services must prevent drive redirection. - Pass
    • V-254367 - Windows Server 2022 Remote Desktop Services must always prompt a client for passwords upon connection. - Pass
    • V-254368 - Windows Server 2022 Remote Desktop Services must require secure Remote Procedure Call (RPC) communications. - Pass
    • V-254369 - Windows Server 2022 Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to High Level. - Pass
    • V-254370 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent attachments from being downloaded from RSS feeds. - Pass
    • V-254371 - Windows Server 2022 must disable Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP. - Pass
    • V-254372 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent Indexing of encrypted files. - Pass
    • V-254373 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent users from changing installation options. - Pass
    • V-254375 - Windows Server 2022 users must be notified if a web-based program attempts to install software. - Pass
    • V-254376 - Windows Server 2022 must disable automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart. - Pass
    • V-254377 - Windows Server 2022 PowerShell script block logging must be enabled. - Pass
    • V-254379 - Windows Server 2022 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not allow unencrypted traffic. - Pass
    • V-254380 - Windows Server 2022 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Digest authentication. - Pass
    • V-254382 - Windows Server 2022 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not allow unencrypted traffic. - Pass
    • V-254383 - Windows Server 2022 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not store RunAs credentials. - Pass
    • V-254384 - Windows Server 2022 must have PowerShell Transcription enabled. - Pass
    • V-254431 - Windows Server 2022 must restrict unauthenticated Remote Procedure Call (RPC) clients from connecting to the RPC server on domain-joined member servers and standalone or nondomain-joined systems. - Pass
    • V-254433 - Windows Server 2022 must restrict remote calls to the Security Account Manager (SAM) to Administrators on domain-joined member servers and standalone or nondomain-joined systems. - Pass
    • V-254434 - Windows Server 2022 Access this computer from the network user right must only be assigned to the Administrators and Authenticated Users groups on domain-joined member servers and standalone or nondomain-joined systems. - Pass
    • V-254435 - Windows Server 2022 Deny access to this computer from the network user right on domain-joined member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts and from unauthenticated access on all systems. - Pass
    • V-254436 - Windows Server 2022 Deny log on as a batch job user right on domain-joined member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and from unauthenticated access on all systems. - Pass
    • V-254438 - Windows Server 2022 Deny log on locally user right on domain-joined member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and from unauthenticated access on all systems. - Pass
    • V-254439 - Windows Server 2022 Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services user right on domain-joined member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and all local accounts and from unauthenticated access on all systems. - Pass
    • V-254440 - Windows Server 2022 Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts on domain-joined member servers and standalone or nondomain-joined systems. - Pass
    • V-254442 - Windows Server 2022 must have the DoD Root Certificate Authority (CA) certificates installed in the Trusted Root Store. - Fail
    • V-254443 - Windows Server 2022 must have the DoD Interoperability Root Certificate Authority (CA) cross-certificates installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems. - Fail
    • V-254444 - Windows Server 2022 must have the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems. - Fail
    • V-254445 - Windows Server 2022 must have the built-in guest account disabled. - Pass
    • V-254447 - Windows Server 2022 built-in administrator account must be renamed. - Fail
    • V-254448 - Windows Server 2022 built-in guest account must be renamed. - Fail
    • V-254449 - Windows Server 2022 must force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings. - Pass
    • V-254450 - Windows Server 2022 setting Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-254451 - Windows Server 2022 setting Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-254452 - Windows Server 2022 setting Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-254453 - Windows Server 2022 computer account password must not be prevented from being reset. - Pass
    • V-254454 - Windows Server 2022 maximum age for machine account passwords must be configured to 30 days or less. - Pass
    • V-254455 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to require a strong session key. - Pass
    • V-254456 - Windows Server 2022 machine inactivity limit must be set to 15 minutes or less, locking the system with the screen saver. - Pass
    • V-254457 - Windows Server 2022 required legal notice must be configured to display before console logon. - Pass
    • V-254459 - Windows Server 2022 Smart Card removal option must be configured to Force Logoff or Lock Workstation. - Pass
    • V-254460 - Windows Server 2022 setting Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-254461 - Windows Server 2022 setting Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-254462 - Windows Server 2022 unencrypted passwords must not be sent to third-party Server Message Block (SMB) servers. - Pass
    • V-254463 - Windows Server 2022 setting Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-254464 - Windows Server 2022 setting Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-254468 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to prevent anonymous users from having the same permissions as the Everyone group. - Pass
    • V-254470 - Windows Server 2022 services using Local System that use Negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication must use the computer identity instead of authenticating anonymously. - Pass
    • V-254471 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent NTLM from falling back to a Null session. - Pass
    • V-254472 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent PKU2U authentication using online identities. - Pass
    • V-254473 - Windows Server 2022 Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES and RC4 encryption suites. - Pass
    • V-254476 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to at least negotiate signing for LDAP client signing. - Pass
    • V-254477 - Windows Server 2022 session security for NTLM SSP-based clients must be configured to require NTLMv2 session security and 128-bit encryption. - Pass
    • V-254478 - Windows Server 2022 session security for NTLM SSP-based servers must be configured to require NTLMv2 session security and 128-bit encryption. - Pass
    • V-254479 - Windows Server 2022 users must be required to enter a password to access private keys stored on the computer. - Pass
    • V-254480 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to use FIPS-compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing. - Pass
    • V-254482 - Windows Server 2022 User Account Control (UAC) approval mode for the built-in Administrator must be enabled. - Pass
    • V-254483 - Windows Server 2022 UIAccess applications must not be allowed to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop. - Pass
    • V-254484 - Windows Server 2022 User Account Control (UAC) must, at a minimum, prompt administrators for consent on the secure desktop. - Pass
    • V-254485 - Windows Server 2022 User Account Control (UAC) must automatically deny standard user requests for elevation. - Pass
    • V-254486 - Windows Server 2022 User Account Control (UAC) must be configured to detect application installations and prompt for elevation. - Pass
    • V-254487 - Windows Server 2022 User Account Control (UAC) must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations. - Pass
    • V-254488 - Windows Server 2022 User Account Control (UAC) must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC. - Pass
    • V-254489 - Windows Server 2022 User Account Control (UAC) must virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations. - Pass
    • V-254491 - Windows Server 2022 Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-254493 - Windows Server 2022 Allow log on locally user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254494 - Windows Server 2022 back up files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254495 - Windows Server 2022 create a pagefile user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254497 - Windows Server 2022 create global objects user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service. - Pass
    • V-254498 - Windows Server 2022 create permanent shared objects user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-254499 - Windows Server 2022 create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254501 - Windows Server 2022 force shutdown from a remote system user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254502 - Windows Server 2022 generate security audits user right must only be assigned to Local Service and Network Service. - Pass
    • V-254503 - Windows Server 2022 impersonate a client after authentication user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service. - Pass
    • V-254504 - Windows Server 2022 increase scheduling priority: user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254505 - Windows Server 2022 load and unload device drivers user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254506 - Windows Server 2022 lock pages in memory user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-254507 - Windows Server 2022 manage auditing and security log user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254508 - Windows Server 2022 modify firmware environment values user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254509 - Windows Server 2022 perform volume maintenance tasks user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254510 - Windows Server 2022 profile single process user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254511 - Windows Server 2022 restore files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-254512 - Windows Server 2022 take ownership of files or other objects user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass

    Manual Checks

    • V-254238 - Windows Server 2022 users with Administrative privileges must have separate accounts for administrative duties and normal operational tasks. - Not Checked
    • V-254239 - Windows Server 2022 passwords for the built-in Administrator account must be changed at least every 60 days. - Not Checked
    • V-254241 - Windows Server 2022 members of the Backup Operators group must have separate accounts for backup duties and normal operational tasks. - Not Checked
    • V-254242 - Windows Server 2022 manually managed application account passwords must be at least 15 characters in length. - Not Checked
    • V-254243 - Windows Server 2022 manually managed application account passwords must be changed at least annually or when a system administrator with knowledge of the password leaves the organization. - Not Checked
    • V-254244 - Windows Server 2022 shared user accounts must not be permitted. - Not Checked
    • V-254245 - Windows Server 2022 must employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs. - Not Checked
    • V-254246 - Windows Server 2022 domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled and ready for use. - Not Checked
    • V-254248 - Windows Server 2022 must use an antivirus program. - Not Checked
    • V-254249 - Windows Server 2022 must have a host-based intrusion detection or prevention system. - Not Checked
    • V-254251 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the system drive root directory (usually C:\) must conform to minimum requirements. - Not Checked
    • V-254252 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for program file directories must conform to minimum requirements. - Not Checked
    • V-254253 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the Windows installation directory must conform to minimum requirements. - Not Checked
    • V-254254 - Windows Server 2022 default permissions for the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE registry hive must be maintained. - Not Checked
    • V-254256 - Windows Server 2022 outdated or unused accounts must be removed or disabled. - Not Checked
    • V-254257 - Windows Server 2022 accounts must require passwords. - Not Checked
    • V-254258 - Windows Server 2022 passwords must be configured to expire. - Not Checked
    • V-254259 - Windows Server 2022 system files must be monitored for unauthorized changes. - Not Checked
    • V-254260 - Windows Server 2022 nonsystem-created file shares must limit access to groups that require it. - Not Checked
    • V-254261 - Windows Server 2022 must have software certificate installation files removed. - Not Checked
    • V-254262 - Windows Server 2022 systems requiring data at rest protections must employ cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of the information at rest. - Not Checked
    • V-254263 - Windows Server 2022 must implement protection methods such as TLS, encrypted VPNs, or IPsec if the data owner has a strict requirement for ensuring data integrity and confidentiality is maintained at every step of the data transfer and handling process. - Not Checked
    • V-254264 - Windows Server 2022 must have the roles and features required by the system documented. - Not Checked
    • V-254265 - Windows Server 2022 must have a host-based firewall installed and enabled. - Not Checked
    • V-254266 - Windows Server 2022 must employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation using the following frequency: continuously, where Endpoint Security Solution (ESS) is used; 30 days, for any additional internal network scans not covered by ESS; and annually, for external scans by Computer Network Defense Service Provider (CNDSP). - Not Checked
    • V-254267 - Windows Server 2022 must automatically remove or disable temporary user accounts after 72 hours. - Not Checked
    • V-254268 - Windows Server 2022 must automatically remove or disable emergency accounts after the crisis is resolved or within 72 hours. - Not Checked
    • V-254280 - Windows Server 2022 FTP servers must be configured to prevent access to the system drive. - Not Checked
    • V-254282 - Windows Server 2022 must have orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) removed from user rights. - Not Checked
    • V-254294 - Windows Server 2022 audit records must be backed up to a different system or media than the system being audited. - Not Checked
    • V-254295 - Windows Server 2022 must, at a minimum, offload audit records of interconnected systems in real time and offload standalone or nondomain-joined systems weekly. - Not Checked
    • V-254317 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage successes. - Not Checked
    • V-254318 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures. - Not Checked
    • V-254343 - Windows Server 2022 virtualization-based security must be enabled with the platform security level configured to Secure Boot or Secure Boot with DMA Protection. - Not Checked
    • V-254396 - Windows Server 2022 data files owned by users must be on a different logical partition from the directory server data files. - Not Checked
    • V-254397 - Windows Server 2022 domain controllers must run on a machine dedicated to that function. - Not Checked
    • V-254398 - Windows Server 2022 must use separate, NSA-approved (Type 1) cryptography to protect the directory data in transit for directory service implementations at a classified confidentiality level when replication data traverses a network cleared to a lower level than the data. - Not Checked
    • V-254401 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory Group Policy objects must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-254402 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory Domain object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-254403 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory Infrastructure object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-254404 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory Domain Controllers Organizational Unit (OU) object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-254405 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory AdminSDHolder object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-254406 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory RID Manager$ object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-254412 - Windows Server 2022 domain controllers must have a PKI server certificate. - Not Checked
    • V-254415 - Windows Server 2022 Active Directory user accounts, including administrators, must be configured to require the use of a Common Access Card (CAC), Personal Identity Verification (PIV)-compliant hardware token, or Alternate Logon Token (ALT) for user authentication. - Not Checked
    • V-254427 - The password for the krbtgt account on a domain must be reset at least every 180 days. - Not Checked
    • V-254490 - Windows Server 2022 must preserve zone information when saving attachments. - Not Checked

Results: Low Severity (CAT III)

    Automated Checks

    • V-254335 - Windows Server 2022 Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent IP source routing. - Pass
    • V-254336 - Windows Server 2022 source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent Internet Protocol (IP) source routing. - Pass
    • V-254337 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to prevent Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects from overriding Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)-generated routes. - Pass
    • V-254338 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers. - Pass
    • V-254351 - Windows Server 2022 Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft. - Pass
    • V-254357 - Windows Server 2022 Windows Update must not obtain updates from other PCs on the internet. - Pass
    • V-254363 - Windows Server 2022 Turning off File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled. - Pass
    • V-254481 - Windows Server 2022 default permissions of global system objects must be strengthened. - Fail

    Manual Checks

    • V-254255 - Windows Server 2022 nonadministrative accounts or groups must only have print permissions on printer shares. - Not Checked
    • V-254281 - The Windows Server 2022 time service must synchronize with an appropriate DoD time source. - Not Checked
    • V-254400 - Windows Server 2022 directory service must be configured to terminate LDAP-based network connections to the directory server after five minutes of inactivity. - Not Checked
    • V-254458 - Windows Server 2022 title for legal banner dialog box must be configured with the appropriate text. - Not Checked

Detailed Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    V-254250 - Windows Server 2022 local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254250r848566_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-00-000130
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: The ability to set access permissions and auditing is critical to maintaining the security and proper access controls of a system. To support this, volumes must be formatted using a file system that supports NTFS attributes. false
    Fix Text:Format volumes to use NTFS or ReFS.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254250
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-00-000130 - Windows Server 2022 local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes.
    Description:The ability to set access permissions and auditing is critical to maintaining the security and proper access controls of a system. To support this, volumes must be formatted using a file system that supports NTFS attributes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (local volumes are formatted using NTFS or ReFS)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25425000 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:local volumes are formatted using NTFS or ReFS
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25425000 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT filesystem FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3 AND filesystem!='NTFS' AND filesystem!='ReFS''
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT filesystem FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3 AND filesystem!='NTFS' AND filesystem!='ReFS''

    V-254293 - Windows Server 2022 reversible password encryption must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254293r877397_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000090
    Identities:CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
    Description: Storing passwords using reversible encryption is essentially the same as storing clear-text versions of the passwords, which are easily compromised. For this reason, this policy must never be enabled. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Store passwords using reversible encryption to "Disabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254293
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000090 - Windows Server 2022 reversible password encryption must be disabled.
    Description:Storing passwords using reversible encryption is essentially the same as storing clear-text versions of the passwords, which are easily compromised. For this reason, this policy must never be enabled.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330500 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330500 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', reversible_encryption must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '5184000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '86400'
    • min_passwd_len equals '14'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-254352 - Windows Server 2022 Autoplay must be turned off for nonvolume devices.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254352r848872_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-CC-000210
    Identities:CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (2))
    Description: Allowing AutoPlay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. AutoPlay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted into the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. This setting will disable AutoPlay for nonvolume devices, such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> Disallow Autoplay for nonvolume devices to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254352
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-CC-000210 - Windows Server 2022 Autoplay must be turned off for nonvolume devices.
    Description:Allowing AutoPlay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. AutoPlay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted into the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. This setting will disable AutoPlay for nonvolume devices, such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25338600 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25338600 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'NoAutoplayfornonVolume'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer'
    • name equals 'NoAutoplayfornonVolume'
    • last_write_time equals '133380675260000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254353 - Windows Server 2022 default AutoRun behavior must be configured to prevent AutoRun commands.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254353r848875_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-CC-000220
    Identities:CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (2))

    V-254354 - Windows Server 2022 AutoPlay must be disabled for all drives.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254354r848878_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-CC-000230
    Identities:CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (2))
    Description: Allowing AutoPlay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. AutoPlay begins reading from a drive as soon media is inserted into the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. By default, AutoPlay is disabled on removable drives, such as the floppy disk drive (but not the CD-ROM drive) and on network drives. Enabling this policy disables AutoPlay on all drives. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> Turn off AutoPlay to "Enabled" with "All Drives" selected.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254354
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-CC-000230 - Windows Server 2022 AutoPlay must be disabled for all drives.
    Description:Allowing AutoPlay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. AutoPlay begins reading from a drive as soon media is inserted into the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. By default, AutoPlay is disabled on removable drives, such as the floppy disk drive (but not the CD-ROM drive) and on network drives. Enabling this policy disables AutoPlay on all drives.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Turn off AutoPlay' is set to 'Enabled:All Drives')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25338800 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Turn off AutoPlay' is set to 'Enabled:All Drives'
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25338800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'NoDriveTypeAutoRun'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25338800 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '255'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
    • name equals 'NoDriveTypeAutoRun'
    • last_write_time equals '133380574850000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '255'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254378 - Windows Server 2022 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Basic authentication.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254378r877395_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-CC-000470
    Identities:CCI-000877 (NIST SP 800-53: MA-4 c; NIST SP 800-53A: MA-4.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 c)
    Description: Basic authentication uses plain-text passwords that could be used to compromise a system. Disabling Basic authentication will reduce this potential. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Remote Management (WinRM) >> WinRM Client >> Allow Basic authentication to "Disabled".

    Weight:10.0

      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Allow Basic authentication' is set to 'Disabled')

    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client'
    • name must be equal to 'AllowBasic'

    V-254446 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent local accounts with blank passwords from being used from the network.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254446r849154_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-SO-000020
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: An account without a password can allow unauthorized access to a system as only the username would be required. Password policies must prevent accounts with blank passwords from existing on a system. However, if a local account with a blank password does exist, enabling this setting will prevent network access, limiting the account to local console logon only. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254446
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-SO-000020 - Windows Server 2022 must prevent local accounts with blank passwords from being used from the network.
    Description:An account without a password can allow unauthorized access to a system as only the username would be required. Password policies must prevent accounts with blank passwords from existing on a system. However, if a local account with a blank password does exist, enabling this setting will prevent network access, limiting the account to local console logon only.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25343400 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25343400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal to 'LimitBlankPasswordUse'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'LimitBlankPasswordUse'
    • last_write_time equals '133380658720000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254465 - Windows Server 2022 must not allow anonymous SID/Name translation.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254465r849211_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-SO-000210
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Allowing anonymous SID/Name translation can provide sensitive information for accessing a system. Only authorized users must be able to perform such translations. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation to "Disabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485

    Result:true

    Description:Windows Server 2022 must not allow anonymous SID/Name translation.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Windows Server must not allow anonymous SID/Name translation.)
    Tests:

    Result:true
    Title:Windows Server must not allow anonymous SID/Name translation.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:4541 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:ste:4541 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', anonymous_name_lookup must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '5184000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '86400'
    • min_passwd_len equals '14'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-254466 - Windows Server 2022 must not allow anonymous enumeration of Security Account Manager (SAM) accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254466r849214_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-SO-000220
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts allows anonymous logon users (null session connections) to list all accounts names, thus providing a list of potential points to attack the system. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254466
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-SO-000220 - Windows Server 2022 must not allow anonymous enumeration of Security Account Manager (SAM) accounts.
    Description:Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts allows anonymous logon users (null session connections) to list all accounts names, thus providing a list of potential points to attack the system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25345300 (registry_test)
    Result:true

    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25345300 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'RestrictAnonymousSAM'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

    [ true ]

    • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'RestrictAnonymousSAM'
    • last_write_time equals '133380658720000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254467 - Windows Server 2022 must not allow anonymous enumeration of shares.

    V-254469 - Windows Server 2022 must restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254469r849223_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-SO-000250
    Identities:CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-4)
    Description: Allowing anonymous access to named pipes or shares provides the potential for unauthorized system access. This setting restricts access to those defined in "Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously" and "Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously", both of which must be blank under other requirements. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0

    Result:true
    Title:WN22-SO-000250 - Windows Server 2022 must restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares.
    Description:Allowing anonymous access to named pipes or shares provides the potential for unauthorized system access. This setting restricts access to those defined in "Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously" and "Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously", both of which must be blank under other requirements.

    V-254474 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254474r877397_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-SO-000300
    Identities:CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
    Description: The LAN Manager hash uses a weak encryption algorithm and there are several tools available that use this hash to retrieve account passwords. This setting controls whether a LAN Manager hash of the password is stored in the SAM the next time the password is changed. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254474
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-SO-000300 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.
    Description:The LAN Manager hash uses a weak encryption algorithm and there are several tools available that use this hash to retrieve account passwords. This setting controls whether a LAN Manager hash of the password is stored in the SAM the next time the password is changed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25346100 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25346100 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'NoLMHash'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'NoLMHash'
    • last_write_time equals '133380658720000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254475 - Windows Server 2022 LAN Manager authentication level must be configured to send NTLMv2 response only and to refuse LM and NTLM.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254475r849241_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-SO-000310
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The Kerberos v5 authentication protocol is the default for authentication of users who are logging on to domain accounts. NTLM, which is less secure, is retained in later Windows versions for compatibility with clients and servers that are running earlier versions of Windows or applications that still use it. It is also used to authenticate logons to standalone or nondomain-joined computers that are running later versions. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> Network security: LAN Manager authentication level to "Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254475
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-SO-000310 - Windows Server 2022 LAN Manager authentication level must be configured to send NTLMv2 response only and to refuse LM and NTLM.
    Description:The Kerberos v5 authentication protocol is the default for authentication of users who are logging on to domain accounts. NTLM, which is less secure, is retained in later Windows versions for compatibility with clients and servers that are running earlier versions of Windows or applications that still use it. It is also used to authenticate logons to standalone or nondomain-joined computers that are running later versions.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is set to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM' (Level 5))
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25346200 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is set to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM' (Level 5)
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25346200 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal to 'LmCompatibilityLevel'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25346200 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '5'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'LmCompatibilityLevel'
    • last_write_time equals '133380658720000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '5'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254492 - Windows Server 2022 Act as part of the operating system user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254492r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-UR-000020
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Act as part of the operating system" user right can assume the identity of any user and gain access to resources that the user is authorized to access. Any accounts with this right can take complete control of a system. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> Act as part of the operating system to be defined but containing no entries (blank).
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254492
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-UR-000020 - Windows Server 2022 Act as part of the operating system user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Act as part of the operating system" user right can assume the identity of any user and gain access to resources that the user is authorized to access. Any accounts with this right can take complete control of a system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (No users have the privilege to act as part of the operating system.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25348100 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:true
    Title:No users have the privilege to act as part of the operating system.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000008 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must match the pattern '.+'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25348100 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', setcbprivilege must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • setcbprivilege equals '1' for:
    • setcbprivilege equals '0' for Access Control Assistance Operators, Administrators, Backup Operators, Certificate Service DCOM Access, Cryptographic Operators, Device Owners, Distributed COM Users, Event Log Readers, Guests, Hyper-V Administrators, IIS_IUSRS, Network Configuration Operators, Performance Log Users, Performance Monitor Users, Power Users, Print Operators, RDS Endpoint Servers, RDS Management Servers, RDS Remote Access Servers, Remote Desktop Users, Remote Management Users, Replicator, Storage Replica Administrators, System Managed Accounts Group, Users, Administrator, DefaultAccount, Guest, WDAGUtilityAccount, NETWORK SERVICE, LOCAL SERVICE, SYSTEM, IUSR, TERMINAL SERVER USER, Authenticated Users, ENTERPRISE DOMAIN CONTROLLERS, PROXY, ANONYMOUS LOGON, SERVICE, INTERACTIVE, BATCH, NETWORK, DIALUP, CREATOR GROUP SERVER, CREATOR OWNER SERVER, CREATOR GROUP, CREATOR OWNER, Everyone, NT SERVICE\WdiServiceHost, NT SERVICE\ALL SERVICES

    V-254496 - Windows Server 2022 create a token object user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254496r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-UR-000060
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Create a token object" user right allows a process to create an access token. This could be used to provide elevated rights and compromise a system. false

    The "Create a token object" user right allows a process to create an access token. This could be used to provide elevated rights and compromise a system.

    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25348600 (accesstoken_state)
