    V-254275 - Windows Server 2022 must not the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol installed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254275r848641_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-00-000380
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks and is not FIPS compliant. false
    Fix Text:Uninstall the SMBv1 protocol.

    Open "Windows PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).

    Enter "Uninstall-WindowsFeature -Name FS-SMB1 -Restart".
    (Omit the Restart parameter if an immediate restart of the system cannot be done.)

    Alternately:

    Start "Server Manager".

    Select the server with the feature.

    Scroll down to "ROLES AND FEATURES" in the right pane.

    Select "Remove Roles and Features" from the drop-down "TASKS" list.

    Select the appropriate server on the "Server Selection" page and click "Next".

    Deselect "SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support" on the "Features" page.

    Click "Next" and "Remove" as prompted.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254275
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-00-000380 - Windows Server 2022 must not the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol installed.
    Description:SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks and is not FIPS compliant.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
            • true ('Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled')
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
            • true ('Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver')
        • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328600 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328600 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328600 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '2'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328700 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328700 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name must be equal to 'SMB1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name equals 'SMB1'
    • last_write_time equals '133380657200000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '0'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328800 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name must be equal to 'Start'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000004 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name equals 'Start'
    • last_write_time equals '133380571910000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '4'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254276 - Windows Server 2022 must have the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol disabled on the SMB server.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254276r848644_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-00-000390
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> Configure SMBv1 Server to "Disabled".

    The system must be restarted for the change to take effect.

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254276
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-00-000390 - Windows Server 2022 must have the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol disabled on the SMB server.
    Description:SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
        • true ('Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328600 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328600 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328600 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '2'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328700 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328700 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name must be equal to 'SMB1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name equals 'SMB1'
    • last_write_time equals '133380657200000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '0'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254277 - Windows Server 2022 must have the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol disabled on the SMB client.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254277r848647_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-00-000400
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> Configure SMBv1 client driver to "Enabled" with "Disable driver (recommended)" selected for "Configure MrxSmb10 driver".

    The system must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254277
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-00-000400 - Windows Server 2022 must have the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol disabled on the SMB client.
    Description:SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
        • true ('Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328600 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328600 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328600 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '2'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328800 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name must be equal to 'Start'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000004 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name equals 'Start'
    • last_write_time equals '133380571910000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '4'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-254278 - Windows Server 2022 must not have Windows PowerShell 2.0 installed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254278r848650_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-00-000410
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Windows PowerShell 5.x added advanced logging features that can provide additional detail when malware has been run on a system. Disabling the Windows PowerShell 2.0 mitigates against a downgrade attack that evades the Windows PowerShell 5.x script block logging feature. false
    Fix Text:Uninstall the "Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine".

    Start "Server Manager".

    Select the server with the feature.

    Scroll down to "ROLES AND FEATURES" in the right pane.

    Select "Remove Roles and Features" from the drop-down "TASKS" list.

    Select the appropriate server on the "Server Selection" page and click "Next".

    Deselect "Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine" under "Windows PowerShell" on the "Features" page.

    Click "Next" and "Remove" as prompted.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254278
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-00-000410 - Windows Server 2022 must not have Windows PowerShell 2.0 installed.
    Description:Windows PowerShell 5.x added advanced logging features that can provide additional detail when malware has been run on a system. Disabling the Windows PowerShell 2.0 mitigates against a downgrade attack that evades the Windows PowerShell 5.x script block logging feature.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Windows PowerShell 2.0 feature is not installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25427800 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Windows PowerShell 2.0 feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000014 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT ID FROM Win32_ServerFeature'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25427800 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • no id must be equal to '411'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT ID FROM Win32_ServerFeature'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '481'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '418'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '466'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '420'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '425'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '412'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '417'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '482'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '1043'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '1003'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '340'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '338'

    V-254279 - Windows Server 2022 FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254279r848653_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Error
    Version:WN22-00-000420
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The FTP service allows remote users to access shared files and directories. Allowing anonymous FTP connections makes user auditing difficult.

    Using accounts that have administrator privileges to log on to FTP risks that the userid and password will be captured on the network and give administrator access to an unauthorized user. false
    Fix Text:Configure the FTP service to prevent anonymous logons.

    Open "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".

    Select the server.

    Double-click "FTP Authentication".

    Select "Anonymous Authentication".

    Select "Disabled" under "Actions".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:def:821
    Result:error
    Title:SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227, SV-254279r848653
    Description:Windows Server 2022 FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • not applicable (Windows Server 2022 FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.)
      • error (If FTP is not installed on the system, this is NA.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:tst:821 (appcmdlistconfig_test)
    Result:not applicable
    Title:Windows Server 2022 FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:821 (appcmdlistconfig_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • identifier_type must be equal to 'Site'
    • identifier must match the pattern '.*'
    • section must be equal to 'system.applicationHost/sites'
    • parameter must be equal to 'siteDefaults.ftpServer.security.authentication.anonymousAuthentication.enabled'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:ste:821 (appcmdlistconfig_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to 'false'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:tst:822 (cmdlet_test)
    Result:error
    Title:If FTP is not installed on the system, this is NA.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:822 (cmdlet_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • module_name must be equal to 'Microsoft.Powershell.Management'
    • verb must be equal to 'Get'
    • noun must be equal to 'WindowsFeature'
    • for 'parameters' the following must be true:
      • name must be equal to 'Web-FTP-Server'
    • for 'select' the following must be true:
      • property must be equal to 'installstate'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:ste:822 (cmdlet_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'value' the following must be true:
      • all installstate must not be equal (case insensitive) to 'installed'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Error Information:"Unable to determine PowerShell version. Powershell review cannot be attempted" from Probe_Cmdlet found in Probe_Cmdlet (159).
    An error occurred gathering object oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:822 causing all tests using that object to be flagged as 'error'. Refer to the earlier error statements refering to that object for more detail.

    V-254283 - Windows Server 2022 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254283r848665_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN22-00-000460
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: UEFI provides additional security features in comparison to legacy BIOS firmware, including Secure Boot. UEFI is required to support additional security features in Windows, including Virtualization Based Security and Credential Guard. Systems with UEFI that are operating in "Legacy BIOS" mode will not support these security features. false
    Fix Text:Configure UEFI firmware to run in "UEFI" mode, not "Legacy BIOS" mode.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:def:901
    Result:false
    Title:SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227, SV-254283r848665
    Description:Windows Server 2022 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware must exist and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:tst:901 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware must exist and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:One and only one item may match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:901 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecureBoot\State'
    • name must be equal to 'UEFISecureBootEnabled'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:ste:901 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-254284 - Windows Server 2022 must have Secure Boot enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254284r848668_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN22-00-000470
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Secure Boot is a standard that ensures systems boot only to a trusted operating system. Secure Boot is required to support additional security features in Windows, including Virtualization Based Security and Credential Guard. If Secure Boot is turned off, these security features will not function. false
    Fix Text:Enable Secure Boot in the system firmware.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:

    Result:false
    Title:SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227, SV-254284r848668
    Description:Windows Server 2022 must have Secure Boot enabled.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (Secure Boot must be enabled)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:tst:921 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Secure Boot must be enabled
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:921 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecureBoot\State'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-254285 - Windows Server 2022 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254285r848671_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000010
    Identities:CCI-002238 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 b)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that an account will remain locked after the specified number of failed logon attempts. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> Account lockout duration to "15" minutes or greater.

    A value of "0" is also acceptable, requiring an administrator to unlock the account.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254285
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000010 - Windows Server 2022 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.
    Description:The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that an account will remain locked after the specified number of failed logon attempts.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false ('Account lockout duration' is set to '0')
          • true ('Account lockout duration' is set to '15 minutes' or greater)
        • true ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329700 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Account lockout duration' is set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329700 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be less than or equal to '0'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329701 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be equal to '4294967295'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '900'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '900'
    • lockout_threshold equals '3'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    lockout_duration
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329701 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout duration' is set to '15 minutes' or greater
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.

    • lockout_threshold equals '3'

    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • lockout_threshold equals '3'

    V-254286 - Windows Server 2022 must have the number of allowed bad logon attempts configured to three or less.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254286r848674_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000020
    Identities:CCI-000044 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 a)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. The higher this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. The number of bad logon attempts must be reasonably small to minimize the possibility of a successful password attack while allowing for honest errors made during normal user logon. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> Account lockout threshold to "3" or fewer invalid logon attempts (excluding "0", which is unacceptable).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254286
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000020 - Windows Server 2022 must have the number of allowed bad logon attempts configured to three or less.
    Description:The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. The higher this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. The number of bad logon attempts must be reasonably small to minimize the possibility of a successful password attack while allowing for honest errors made during normal user logon.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less)
        • true ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329800 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329800 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be less than or equal to '3'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '900'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '900'
    • lockout_threshold equals '3'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '900'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '900'
    • lockout_threshold equals '3'

    V-254287 - Windows Server 2022 must have the period of time before the bad logon counter is reset configured to 15 minutes or greater.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254287r848677_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000030
    Identities:CCI-000044 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 a)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that must pass after failed logon attempts before the counter is reset to "0". The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> Reset account lockout counter after to at least "15" minutes.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254287
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000030 - Windows Server 2022 must have the period of time before the bad logon counter is reset configured to 15 minutes or greater.
    Description:The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that must pass after failed logon attempts before the counter is reset to "0". The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least the required value)
        • true ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:

    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_observation_window must be greater than or equal to '900'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '900'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '900'
    • lockout_threshold equals '3'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    V-254288 - Windows Server 2022 password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254288r848680_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000040
    Identities:CCI-000200 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (e); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (e))
    Description: A system is more vulnerable to unauthorized access when system users recycle the same password several times without being required to change to a unique password on a regularly scheduled basis. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. The default value is "24" for Windows domain systems. DoD has decided this is the appropriate value for all Windows systems. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Enforce password history to "24" passwords remembered.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254288
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000040 - Windows Server 2022 password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.
    Description:A system is more vulnerable to unauthorized access when system users recycle the same password several times without being required to change to a unique password on a regularly scheduled basis. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. The default value is "24" for Windows domain systems. DoD has decided this is the appropriate value for all Windows systems.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330000 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330000 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', password_hist_len must be greater than or equal to '24'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '5184000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '86400'
    • min_passwd_len equals '14'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-254289 - Windows Server 2022 maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254289r848683_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000050
    Identities:CCI-000199 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
    Description: The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords. Scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Maximum password age to "60" days or less (excluding "0", which is unacceptable).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254289
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000050 - Windows Server 2022 maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.
    Description:The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords. Scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Maximum Password Age is set to 60 days or less, but greater than 0.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330100 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Maximum Password Age is set to 60 days or less, but greater than 0.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330100 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', max_passwd_age must be less than or equal to '5184000'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330101 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', max_passwd_age must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '5184000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '86400'
    • min_passwd_len equals '14'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-254290 - Windows Server 2022 minimum password age must be configured to at least one day.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254290r848686_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000060
    Identities:CCI-000198 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
    Description: Permitting passwords to be changed in immediate succession within the same day allows users to cycle passwords through their history database. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Minimum password age to at least "1" day.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254290
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000060 - Windows Server 2022 minimum password age must be configured to at least one day.
    Description:Permitting passwords to be changed in immediate succession within the same day allows users to cycle passwords through their history database. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Minimum Password Age' is set to at least '1' day)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330200 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Minimum Password Age' is set to at least '1' day
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330200 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', min_passwd_age must be greater than or equal to '86400'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '5184000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '86400'
    • min_passwd_len equals '14'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-254291 - Windows Server 2022 minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254291r890539_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000070
    Identities:CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    Description: Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum password length" to "14" characters.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254291
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000070 - Windows Server 2022 minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters.
    Description:Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330300 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330300 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', min_passwd_len must be greater than or equal to '14'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '5184000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '86400'
    • min_passwd_len equals '14'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-254292 - Windows Server 2022 must have the built-in Windows password complexity policy enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254292r848692_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AC-000080
    Identities:CCI-000192 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    CCI-000193 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    CCI-000194 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    CCI-001619 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    Description: The use of complex passwords increases their strength against attack. The built-in Windows password complexity policy requires passwords to contain at least three of the four types of characters (numbers, uppercase and lowercase letters, and special characters) and prevents the inclusion of user names or parts of user names.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000069-GPOS-00037, SRG-OS-000070-GPOS-00038, SRG-OS-000071-GPOS-00039, SRG-OS-000266-GPOS-00101 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> Password must meet complexity requirements to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254292
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AC-000080 - Windows Server 2022 must have the built-in Windows password complexity policy enabled.
    Description:The use of complex passwords increases their strength against attack. The built-in Windows password complexity policy requires passwords to contain at least three of the four types of characters (numbers, uppercase and lowercase letters, and special characters) and prevents the inclusion of user names or parts of user names.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000069-GPOS-00037, SRG-OS-000070-GPOS-00038, SRG-OS-000071-GPOS-00039, SRG-OS-000266-GPOS-00101
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330400 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330400 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', password_complexity must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '5184000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '86400'
    • min_passwd_len equals '14'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-254296 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by nonprivileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254296r848704_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000030
    Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
    Fix Text:Configure the permissions on the Application event log file (Application.evtx) to prevent access by nonprivileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\System32\winevt\Logs" folder.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254296
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000030 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by nonprivileged accounts.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path)
          • false (The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.) (negated)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429601 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429601 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334002 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334002 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application'
    • name must be equal to 'file'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000016 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '^(?i)%SystemRoot%.*$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application'
    • name equals 'file'
    • last_write_time equals '133380569660000000'
    • type equals 'reg_expand_sz'
    • value equals '%SystemRoot%\system32\winevt\Logs\Application.evtx'
    • expanded_value equals 'C:\Windows\system32\winevt\Logs\Application.evtx'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429600 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429600 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'

    V-254297 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by nonprivileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254297r848707_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000040
    Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
    Fix Text:Configure the permissions on the Security event log file (Security.evtx) to prevent access by nonprivileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\System32\winevt\Logs" folder.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022

    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029

          • true (The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)

    Exclude Items If:

    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'

    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334102 (registry_test)

    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.

    V-254298 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the System event log must prevent access by nonprivileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254298r848710_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000050
    Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029 false
    Fix Text:Configure the permissions on the System event log file (System.evtx) to prevent access by nonprivileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\System32\winevt\Logs" folder.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254298
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000050 - Windows Server 2022 permissions for the System event log must prevent access by nonprivileged accounts.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The System event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path)
          • false (The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.) (negated)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The System event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429801 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429801 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334202 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334202 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\System'
    • name must be equal to 'file'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000016 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '^(?i)%SystemRoot%.*$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\System'
    • name equals 'file'
    • last_write_time equals '133380525510000000'
    • type equals 'reg_expand_sz'
    • value equals '%SystemRoot%\system32\winevt\Logs\System.evtx'
    • expanded_value equals 'C:\Windows\system32\winevt\Logs\System.evtx'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429800 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429800 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'

    V-254299 - Windows Server 2022 Event Viewer must be protected from unauthorized modification and deletion.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254299r848713_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000060
    Identities:CCI-001494 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9)
    CCI-001495 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9)
    Description: Protecting audit information also includes identifying and protecting the tools used to view and manipulate log data. Therefore, protecting audit tools is necessary to prevent unauthorized operation on audit information.

    Operating systems providing tools to interface with audit information will leverage user permissions and roles identifying the user accessing the tools and the corresponding rights the user enjoys to make access decisions regarding the modification or deletion of audit tools.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098, SRG-OS-000258-GPOS-00099 false
    Fix Text:Configure the permissions on the "Eventvwr.exe" file to prevent modification by any groups or accounts other than TrustedInstaller. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:

    TrustedInstaller - Full Control
    Administrators, SYSTEM, Users, ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES, ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES - Read & Execute

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\System32" folder.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254299
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000060 - Windows Server 2022 Event Viewer must be protected from unauthorized modification and deletion.
    Description:Protecting audit information also includes identifying and protecting the tools used to view and manipulate log data. Therefore, protecting audit tools is necessary to prevent unauthorized operation on audit information.

    Operating systems providing tools to interface with audit information will leverage user permissions and roles identifying the user accessing the tools and the corresponding rights the user enjoys to make access decisions regarding the modification or deletion of audit tools.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098, SRG-OS-000258-GPOS-00099
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Eventvwr.exe: Only Read and Execute rights for users other than TrustedInstaller)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429900 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Eventvwr.exe: Only Read and Execute rights for users other than TrustedInstaller
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429903 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-956008885-3418522649-1831038044-1853292631-2271478464'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25429901 (fileeffectiverights53_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', standard_delete must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', standard_write_dac must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', standard_write_owner must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', generic_write must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_write_data must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_append_data must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_write_ea must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_delete_child must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_write_attributes must be equal to 'false'

    [ true ]
    • filepath equals 'C:\Windows\System32\Eventvwr.exe'
    • path equals 'C:\Windows\System32'

    • trustee_name equals 'APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES'

    • standard_read_control equals '1'
    • standard_write_dac equals '0'

    • file_execute equals '1'
    • file_delete_child equals '0'
    • file_read_attributes equals '1'
    • file_write_attributes equals '0'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]

    V-254300 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254300r848716_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000070
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Credential Validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Logon >> Audit Credential Validation with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254300
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000070 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Credential Validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Credential Validation' is set to 'Success')
        • true ('Audit Credential Validation' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330700 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit Credential Validation' is set to 'Success'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330700 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', credential_validation must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    credential_validation
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330701 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)

    V-254301 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.

    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000080
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    • Collect any available items.

    V-254302 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Management - Other Account Management Events successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254302r848722_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN22-AU-000090
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Other Account Management Events records events such as the access of a password hash or the Password Policy Checking API being called.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> Audit Other Account Management Events with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254302
    Result:false
    Title:WN22-AU-000090 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Management - Other Account Management Events successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Other Account Management Events records events such as the access of a password hash or the Password Policy Checking API being called.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210

    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Audit - Other Account Management Events - 'Success only' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:

    Result:false
    Title:Audit - Other Account Management Events - 'Success only' or 'Success and Failure'

    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.

    V-254303 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254303r848725_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000100
    Identities:CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))

    CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
