    CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security Group Management records events such as creating, deleting, or changing security groups, including changes in group members.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false

    V-254304 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254304r848728_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000110
    Identities:CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-001405 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> Audit User Account Management with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254304
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000110 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit User Account Management' is set to 'Success')
        • true ('Audit User Account Management' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    V-254305 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254305r848731_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000120
    Identities:CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-001405 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> Audit User Account Management with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254305
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000120 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221
    Class:compliance

    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit User Account Management' is set to 'Failure')
        • true ('Audit User Account Management' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')

    V-254306 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Plug and Play Events successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254306r848734_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000130
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Plug and Play activity records events related to the successful connection of external devices. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> Audit PNP Activity with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:def:1361
    Result:true
    Title:SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219, SV-254306r848734
    Description:Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Plug and Play Events successes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled)
      • true (Detailed Tracking - Plug and Play Events successes.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:tst:10000 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:One and only one item may match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:10000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA'
    • name must be equal to 'SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:ste:901 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA'
    • name equals 'SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy'
    • last_write_time equals '133380658720000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:tst:1361 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Detailed Tracking - Plug and Play Events successes.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:1441 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:ste:1361 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', pnp_activity, all of the following must be true:
      • pnp_activity must match the pattern 'AUDIT_(SUCCESS|SUCCESS_FAILURE)'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-254307 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254307r848737_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000140
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Process Creation records events related to the creation of a process and the source.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> Audit Process Creation with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254307
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000140 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Process Creation records events related to the creation of a process and the source.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (Audit - Process Creation - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Process Creation - Success and Failure)
    Tests:

    V-254309 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254309r848743_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000160
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Account Lockout events can be used to identify potentially malicious logon attempts.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> Audit Account Lockout with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254309
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000160 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Account Lockout events can be used to identify potentially malicious logon attempts.

    V-254310 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254310r848746_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000170
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Group Membership records information related to the group membership of a user's logon token. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> Audit Group Membership with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:def:1441
    Result:true
    Title:SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SV-254310r848746
    Description:Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled)
      • true (Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:tst:10000 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:One and only one item may match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:10000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA'
    • name must be equal to 'SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:ste:901 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA'
    • name equals 'SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy'
    • last_write_time equals '133380658720000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:tst:1441 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:obj:1441 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows2022:ste:1441 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', group_membership, all of the following must be true:
      • group_membership must match the pattern 'AUDIT_(SUCCESS|SUCCESS_FAILURE)'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-254311 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit logoff successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254311r848749_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000180
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logoff records user logoffs. If this is an interactive logoff, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> Audit Logoff with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254311
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000180 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit logoff successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logoff records user logoffs. If this is an interactive logoff, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (Audit - Logoff - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Logoff - Success and Failure)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25331500 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Audit - Logoff - Success only
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25331500 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', logoff must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'

    V-254312 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit logon successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254312r848752_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000190
    Identities:CCI-000067 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (1).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (1))
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000032-GPOS-00013, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000472-GPOS-00217, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218, SRG-OS-000475-GPOS-00220 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> Audit Logon with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254312
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000190 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit logon successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000032-GPOS-00013, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000472-GPOS-00217, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218, SRG-OS-000475-GPOS-00220
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Logon' is set to 'Success')
        • true ('Audit Logon' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')

    V-254313 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit logon failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254313r848755_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000200
    Identities:CCI-000067 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (1).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (1))
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000032-GPOS-00013, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000472-GPOS-00217, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218, SRG-OS-000475-GPOS-00220 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> Audit Logon with "Failure" selected.

    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254313
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000200 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit logon failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000032-GPOS-00013, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000472-GPOS-00217, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218, SRG-OS-000475-GPOS-00220
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Logon' is set to 'Failure')
        • true ('Audit Logon' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25331600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit Logon' is set to 'Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25331600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', logon must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    logon

    V-254314 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254314r848758_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000210
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Special Logon records special logons that have administrative privileges and can be used to elevate processes.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000472-GPOS-00217, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218, SRG-OS-000475-GPOS-00220 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> Audit Special Logon with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254314
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000210 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Special Logon records special logons that have administrative privileges and can be used to elevate processes.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000472-GPOS-00217, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218, SRG-OS-000475-GPOS-00220
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (Audit - Special Logon - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Special Logon - Success and Failure)

    V-254315 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254315r848761_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000220
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> Audit Other Object Access Events with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254315
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000220 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects.

    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25332101 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25332101 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_object_access_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    V-254316 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254316r848764_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000230
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects. false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> Audit Other Object Access Events with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254316
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000230 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Failure')
        • true ('Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25332200 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    V-254319 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Policy Change - Audit Policy Change successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254319r848773_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000260
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Policy Change records events related to changes in audit policy.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> Audit Audit Policy Change with "Success" selected.

    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254320
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000270 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Policy Change - Audit Policy Change failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Policy Change records events related to changes in audit policy.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Audit Policy Change - 'Failure only' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25432000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Audit Policy Change - 'Failure only' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25332501 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', audit_policy_change must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25432000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', audit_policy_change must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-254321 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254321r848779_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000280
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Authentication Policy Change records events related to changes in authentication policy, including Kerberos policy and Trust changes.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> Audit Authentication Policy Change with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254321
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000280 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Authentication Policy Change records events related to changes in authentication policy, including Kerberos policy and Trust changes.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210

    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Audit Authentication Policy Change' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure')

    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.

    V-254322 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authorization Policy Change successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254322r848782_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000290
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Authorization Policy Change records events related to changes in user rights, such as "Create a token object".

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> Audit Authorization Policy Change with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254322
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000290 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authorization Policy Change successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.     V-254323 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254323r848785_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000300
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Sensitive Privilege Use records events related to use of sensitive privileges, such as "Act as part of the operating system" or "Debug programs".

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Privilege Use >> Audit Sensitive Privilege Use with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254323
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000300 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Sensitive Privilege Use records events related to use of sensitive privileges, such as "Act as part of the operating system" or "Debug programs".

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Sensitive Privilege Use' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25332900 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Sensitive Privilege Use' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25332900 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sensitive_privilege_use must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25332901 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sensitive_privilege_use must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    [ true ]

    V-254324 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254324r848788_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000310
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Sensitive Privilege Use records events related to use of sensitive privileges, such as "Act as part of the operating system" or "Debug programs".

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Privilege Use >> Audit Sensitive Privilege Use with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254324
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000310 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Sensitive Privilege Use records events related to use of sensitive privileges, such as "Act as part of the operating system" or "Debug programs".

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Sensitive Privilege Use' is set to 'Failure' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25332800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Sensitive Privilege Use' is set to 'Failure' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25332800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sensitive_privilege_use must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'

    V-254325 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - IPsec Driver successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254325r848791_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000320
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    IPsec Driver records events related to the IPsec Driver, such as dropped packets.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> Audit IPsec Driver with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:

    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    ipsec_driver

    V-254327 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - Other System Events successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254327r848797_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000340
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Other System Events records information related to cryptographic key operations and the Windows Firewall service.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> Audit Other System Events with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254327
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000340 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - Other System Events successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Other System Events records information related to cryptographic key operations and the Windows Firewall service.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Other System Events' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25333100 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Other System Events' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25333100 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_system_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25333101 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_system_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    V-254329 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - Security State Change successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254329r848803_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000360
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security State Change records events related to changes in the security state, such as startup and shutdown of the system.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> Audit Security State Chang with "Success" selected.

    Weight:10.0

    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254329
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000360 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - Security State Change successes.

    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    security_state_change

    V-254330 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - Security System Extension successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254330r848806_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000370
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security System Extension records events related to extension code being loaded by the security subsystem.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> Audit Security System Extension with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2022
    Identifier:5485
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2022:def:254330
    Result:true
    Title:WN22-AU-000370 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - Security System Extension successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security System Extension records events related to extension code being loaded by the security subsystem.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Audit Security System Extension' is set to 'Success')
        • false ('Audit Security System Extension' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    V-254331 - Windows Server 2022 must be configured to audit System - System Integrity successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-254331r848809_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN22-AU-000380
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    System Integrity records events related to violations of integrity to the security subsystem.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> Audit System Integrity with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
